items.title: Read only form controls

labels.name: impact: low
labels.description: Affects one or a few users

items.body:
A read only variant of Text input is suggested here: https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-contribution/issues/13#issue-421692303

> The ‚ÄúDisabled‚Äù option is not viable, as the label and entered data is not accessible. Proposal is to simply remove the line at the base of the "Filled" version of the component, so that it closely matches with the Disabled component, but passes accessibility.

## Overview of component (updated May 13)
- Read-only variant will be keeping underline and dropping the background of the field. We need the underline for low-vision users to recognize this as a text field. Also loosing the underline makes the element a button-style, which would be confusing. 
- Not moving the text position after all. Keeping text 16px away from left of border helps with preserving the form structure. 
- Regular text cursor and allows text selecting
- Add `not-editable` icon, icon in PR https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/pull/2710
- Optional tooltip when hovering `not-editable` icon, to provide reason for the field being read-only 
- Overflow text in the field will show in tooltip on hover
- Should be considered a state, possible `readonly` attribute
- Follow the standard readonly attribute: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-readonly

## Design spec (updated May 13)

items.title: [Bug]: Form with FileUploader in a TableExpandedRow causing large empty space below page
items.body: ### Package carbon-components, carbon-components-react ### Browser Chrome ### Package version v10.46.0, v7.46.0 ### Description When using a FileUploader inside a Form that is placed within a TableExpandedRow, the page has a large amount of empty space beneath the page content. Here is an image demonstrating the empty space beneath our Carbon DataTable: After investigating the issue, it seems to be a CSS problem with a class named `bx--visually-hidden`. After setting `display: none`, or changing `position: absolute` to `position: relative`, the large amount of space disappeared without any other obvious changes to the page visuals. Here is an image demonstrating the bottom of our DataTable after making this change: In our app, the empty space exists whether you expand any rows or not. In the CodeSandbox example provided, the empty space below the DataTable is not that large until you expand one of the top three rows, at which point you can see that you can scroll down and see the empty space. ### CodeSandbox example https://codesandbox.io/s/gifted-sara-00019?file=/src/index.js ### Steps to reproduce 1. You are able to scroll to the bottom of the page, despite the content not taking up the full height of the window. 2. Expand any row (except the last), and scroll to the bottom of the page to see a large amount of empty space below. ### Code of Conduct - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/blob/f555616971a03fd454c0f4daea184adf41fff05b/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) - [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues) for duplicate problems

items.title: Datatable with selection: No labels or instructions describing what will happen before a change to a form control
items.body:
## Title line template: [Title]: Brief description

- No labels or instructions describing what will happen before a change to a form control

- When selecting the checkbox as checked, no info to indicate the purpose of the checkbox

## Environment

> Operating system
 WIndows 7 and MacOs catalina

> Browser

Chrome: Version 84.0.4147.89 (Official Build) (64-bit)

> Automated testing tool and ruleset

Jaws and Macos accessibility reader 

> Assistive technology used to verify

## Detailed description

> What version of the Carbon Design System are you using?
Carbon design V10 via @console/pal: 1.248.0

 
> What did you expect to happen?

Screen reader to tells user that the item to be deleted and Delete/Cancel button will be generated on top of the table when the checkbox is ticked.

> What happened instead?

When selecting the checkbox as checked, no info to indicate the purpose of the checkbox. It only says checkbox is checked or not.

> What WCAG 2.1 checkpoint does the issue violate?

Checkpoint 3.2.2 On Input
Changing the setting of any user interface component does not automatically cause a change of context unless the user has been advised of the behavior before using the component. (Level A) (https://www.ibm.com/able/guidelines/ci162/on_input.html)
(https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Techniques/general/G13)

## Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Open Jaws
2. Open https://dev.console.test.cloud.ibm.com/security-advisor#/notifications
2. Open Settings or Notification Channels page
3. Use keyboard to select the any checkbox in the page, the delete/cancel button will be displayed, however Jaws will not read any info about the change



## Additional information

- Screenshots or code

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46310374/92864953-612f3700-f41b-11ea-9fe4-a3b5b7b47b11.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46310374/92864996-6e4c2600-f41b-11ea-908b-e63a7931e059.png)

- Notes

Table select row arialabel value gets associated with checkbox label which is not read by screen readers attaching it to input element should fix this issue.
